column1: Little Goat Diner////My friend and I came here around 2pm on a weekday. There was no wait
column2: and we were seated right away. Our hostess was cheerful and helpful
column3: and successfully helped me navigate the menu and gave suggestions. I ended up going with the korean burger with a veggie patty
column4: and my friend got the fish tacos. We split the onion rings and the fried pickles. They were absolutely divine. A perfectly seasoned batter
column6: with delicious sauces to accompany them. As for the burger
column7: I was in love. I can count on one hand the number of good veggie patties I've had in Chicago
column8: and this makes the list. You can see tender chunks of vegetables throughout
column9: and the patty is spiced perfectly. Not mushy
column10: and crispy on the outside. The rest of the burger was amazing as well. Fried egg
column12: you can't go wrong. I was a little apprehensive about the kimchi as I had had Girl and the Goat's kimchi a few weeks earlier and it was very salty. This was perfect and gave a nice punch to the burger.
